Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218,.proposition: 3. This Court has jurisdiction over this matter pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws Chapter 218, Section 19.

Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186, \u00a7 14.proposition: 6. The lease agreement explicitly grants Plaintiff the right to quiet enjoyment of the premises, as mandated by Massachusetts landlord-tenant law (Mass. Gen. Laws ch. 186, § 14).

Kuzmeskus v. Pickup, 790 N.E.2d 1021, 10.support_reasoning: The provided opinion is Mays v. State from the Indiana Court of Appeals, concerning ineffective assistance of counsel and double jeopardy in a criminal case. It does not involve landlord-tenant law, residential leases, or the covenant of quiet enjoyment, nor is it a Massachusetts case. Therefore, it cannot support the proposition about a Massachusetts implied covenant of quiet enjoyment for noise disturbances, and the citation is clearly inaccurate or mismatched.
